sense.name: an utterance that is a curse or expletive
sense.examples: We heard a loud crash and then a loud oath come from John's office. Such oaths and foul language were not permitted on the airwaves.

sense.name: a legally-binding statement to be truthful in a courtroom
sense.examples: The defendant made those statements under oath. It is considered perjury to make false statements while under oath.

sense.name: a solemn dedication or commitment to something
sense.examples: The president's oath includes the intention to defend and uphold the constitution. The knights made an oath of allegiance to the king.
